intro: Haplophyllum dauricum, commonly known as Daurian haplophyllum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or white, clustered in umbels, and bloom in late summer. Haplophyllum dauricum is adapted to grow in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
